DataElement.preferredName: Nerve Preservation Surgical Procedure Laterality Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: for a nerve-sparing surgical procedure, a designation for the side of the body where the procedure occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the laterality (having to do with one side of the body versus the other) of a nerve preservation (the activity of maintaining or keeping intact any of the bundles of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body) surgical procedure (a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any of the bundles of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body using chemical and electrical signals to transmit sensory and motor information from one body part to another.:The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: Part of the peripheral nervous system composed of bundles of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body using chemical and electrical signals to transmit sensory and motor information from one body part to another.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Laterality; having to do with the use or development of one side of the body versus the other.

Concepts.definition: Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: for a nerve-sparing surgical procedure, a designation for the side of the body where the procedure occurred.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
